title: USWNT Naomi Girma wont be a Gunner - terms agreed with Chelsea Women for record $1 . 1M !
body_text:
The January 2025 transfer window has been marked by a historic move in womenâ€™s football. Chelsea Women have agreed to sign USA defender Naomi Girma from San Diego Wave for a world-record fee of approximately Â£900,000 ($1.1M). This transfer shatters the previous record and establishes Girma as the most expensive female footballer in history.
Arsenal Womenâ€™s connection with Naomi Girma goes back to August 2024, when Jonas Eidevall said of Girma â€œI think sheâ€™s astonishing, a world class talent.â€
Naomi Girma is headed to Chelsea from the San Diego Wave for a $1.1M transfer fee, per @itsmeglinehan

Girmaâ€™s achievements are impressive, including winning Olympic gold with the USA in Paris last summer, where she played every minute of the tournament. She also made history in 2024 by becoming the first defender to win the US Womenâ€™s Player of the Year award.
Her move to The Blues, from NWSL club San Diego Wave, comes at a time when Arsenalâ€™s biggest London rivals are leading the Womenâ€™s Super League, 7 points ahead of our Gunners who are 2nd in the WSL, and Chelsea have progressed to the knockout stages of the Womenâ€™s Champions League â€“ as did our Gunners, who also qualified at the top of their Womenâ€™s Champions League Group.
At just 24 years old, Girma is widely regarded as one of the best defenders in the world. Her exceptional skills and leadership qualities have earned her high praise indeed, with former Chelsea manager and current USWNT head coach Emma Hayes describing her as â€œthe best defender I have ever seenâ€
We wrote an article 7 days ago asking If Arsenal Women ever wanted Naomi Girma, their mission must be too sign her now, before Chelsea do.. but we are now too late. Maybe Arsenalâ€™s pockets werenâ€™t deep enough? Or maybe Renee Slegers was quite right when she said â€œweâ€™re very happy with the players that we have.â€?
